Description: One amulet, one bead. A: small left wedjat eye amulet, made of faience with a dark red to purple glaze. Almost complete, the inner corner of the eye is broken at the perforation, edges rubbed off slightly. The base is flat, the top is textured. B: One flattened spherical bead made of white faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.12, south section, levels 1-2
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
